title: Fragmentary inscription of Lucius Caelius
support:
The upper part of a large plain white marble slab. The top,
                                            left, and right edges are preserved, but only the top edge preserves the
                                            finished edge, albeit with some damage, while the left and right edges have
                                            been more heavily damaged and cut back, possibly for re-use. The rear face
                                            has a crude moulding and is finished although not polished. The slab is
                                            thicker in the middle, and so slightly convex in form. The front face
                                            preserves a 3cm moulding around the left, top and and right edges, at a
                                            distance of c.3.8 cm from the edge of the stone.

layout.p:
The first two lines of a Latin text are preserved, within the
                                        frame created by the moulding.

handNote.lettering:
Neat, regular Letters engraved in a deep, wide v-cut, and refined
                                    interpuncts. The letters have a brown paint within them. Line 2 is only partly
                                    preserved, at least 35mm high.

date._: 1st century CE or beginning 2nd century CE (Korhonen)

provenanceFound._: Found in the eighteenth century in re-use in a wall in the Roman theatre of Catania.

graphics.desc: I.Sicily with the permission of the Assessorato Regionale dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana - Dipartimento dei Beni Culturali e dell’Identità Siciliana

location.address: Castello Ursino, Piazza Federico II di Svevia, 95121 Catania (CT)
